New Records: Shohei Ohtani became the first MLB player with 43 home runs and 43 stolen bases in the same season.
Ohtani was already the first Dodger to join the 40-40 club, achieving the feat in 126 games — the quickest in major-league history.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit an eighth-inning homer, a 380-footer off Paul Sewald, giving the Dodgers a 10-5 lead.
Ohtani achieved his 43rd stolen base in the second inning, taking second base after Diamondbacks starter Zac Gallen threw a pitch in the dirt.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Roberts commented on Ohtani's focus and understanding of the value of the stolen base, especially during a pennant race.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ohtani remains on pace for the first 50-50 season in major-league history.
With two more nights like Friday, Ohtani will match Rickey Henderson for the major-league record of most such games in a single season (13, in 1986).
